articles.author: Courtney Claessens
articles.description: Expand the completeness of your dependency graph by using the dependency submission API, which will create more comprehensive alerts on supply chain vulnerabilities
articles.title: Creating a more comprehensive dependency graph with build time detection

articles.author: Michelle Mannering
articles.description: Each month, we highlight open source projects that have shipped major updates. These projects can include everything from world-changing technology to developer tooling, and weekend hobbies. We cover what the project is and some of their breaking changes. Read about the project, and browse their repositories. Without further ado, here are our top staff picks […]
articles.title: Release Radar · May 2022 Edition

articles.author: Man Yue Mo
articles.description: In this post I’ll exploit CVE-2022-22057, a use-after-free in the Qualcomm gpu kernel driver, to gain root and disable SELinux from the untrusted app sandbox on a Samsung Z flip 3. I’ll look at various mitigations that are implemented on modern Android devices and how they affect the exploit.
articles.title: The Android kernel mitigations obstacle race

articles.author: Lee Reilly
articles.description: Git Merge, the conference dedicated to bringing the Git community together returns on September 14-15 in Chicago, Illinois.
articles.title: Git Merge 2022

articles.description: Teams and GHEC customers can now create blazing fast codespaces, even for your largest and most complex projects.
articles.title: Prebuilding codespaces is generally available

articles.author: Brittany O'Shea
articles.description: To combat the prevalence of malware in the open source ecosystem, GitHub now publishes malware occurrences in the GitHub Advisory Database. These advisories power Dependabot alerts and remain forever free and usable by the community.
articles.title: GitHub now publishes malware advisories in the GitHub Advisory Database

articles.author: Cole Bemis
articles.description: Learn why the GitHub Design Infrastructure team built a dedicated color tool and how they use it to create new color palettes for GitHub.
articles.title: Accelerating GitHub theme creation with color tooling

articles.author: Margaret Tucker
articles.description: We share a recap of a recent roundtable event about what a federal open source software policy could look like in the United States.
articles.title: How can the United States build its Open Source Software policy?

articles.author: Rizel Scarlett
articles.description: June's Open Source Monthly features Modos–a community-focused company building software and hardware that designs digital devices with respect for users' time, attention, and well-being.
articles.title: Open Source Monthly: June 2022 Edition

articles.title: Implementing a robust digital identity
